intro: Aphanactis obtusata, commonly known as the broad-leaved water lily, is a species of aquatic plant native to parts of Australia. It is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves that float on the water's surface, providing habitat for various aquatic organisms. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom above the water, typically during the warmer months. Its roots anchor in the mud at the bottom of still or slow-moving water bodies. Aphanactis obtusata plays an important role in aquatic ecosystems by contributing to water filtration and supporting biodiversity.
